skill.name: Global Tech Stack
skill.description: Understand and apply project-specific technology choices including frameworks, languages, databases, testing tools, and third-party services to maintain consistency across the stack. Use this skill when making technology decisions, adding new dependencies, choosing libraries/frameworks, configuring build tools, setting up databases, implementing authentication, or integrating third-party services. Apply when working with framework-specific code, package managers, ORM configurations, testing setups, deployment configurations, or any task that requires knowledge of the project's chosen technologies to ensure architectural consistency and avoid introducing conflicting tools or patterns.
skill.summary: Understand and apply project-specific technology choices including frameworks, languages, databases,...
skill.author: EIS-ITS

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown instructions for technology stack decisions. No executable code, network calls, file access, or system commands detected. Safe for distribution.

content.value_statement: Projects often fail due to inconsistent technology choices and duplicated tools. This skill ensures AI helpers follow your established technology stack including frameworks, databases, testing tools, and third-party services for architectural consistency.
actual_capabilities: Guides framework and library selection based on project standards
Ensures dependency additions align with existing stack
Validates database and ORM configurations match project conventions
Maintains authentication and authorization implementation patterns
Preserves build tool and deployment pipeline configurations
Prevents introduction of conflicting or duplicate tools
limitations: Requires an existing tech stack definition file to be present
Does not automatically update configuration files
Cannot make decisions about technologies not defined in the stack
Relies on project maintainers to keep stack documentation current

use_cases.title: Enforce Stack Standards
use_cases.description: Ensure all team members and AI helpers use the same frameworks and tools across the project.

use_cases.title: Standardize Deployments
use_cases.description: Maintain consistent build tools and deployment configurations across environments.

use_cases.title: Accelerate Onboarding
use_cases.description: Help new team members understand and adopt correct technology choices quickly.

prompt_templates.title: Add New Dependency
prompt_templates.scenario: When adding a library to package.json
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the global tech stack to check if this library is already in use and if it aligns with our framework choices.

prompt_templates.title: Configure Database
prompt_templates.prompt: Configure the database connection using the ORM and database type specified in our global tech stack.

prompt_templates.title: Choose Testing Framework
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the testing tools and configurations defined in our global tech stack for this project.

prompt_templates.title: Evaluate New Tool
prompt_templates.prompt: Evaluate this new tool against our global tech stack. Does it conflict with existing choices?

output_examples.input: Add HTTP client for API calls
output: Checking global tech stack: Found 'requests' library for Python projects
Using existing 'requests' library as per stack definition
No new dependency needed - existing library meets requirements

best_practices: Keep your tech stack documentation current and accessible to AI helpers
Review technology choices during project architecture planning phase
Document the reasoning behind key technology decisions for future reference
anti_patterns: Introducing new libraries without checking existing alternatives
Using different frameworks for similar tasks across modules
Skipping technology review when adding dependencies

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Compatible with any AI that uses skill-based context.

faq.question: How many technologies can the stack define?
faq.answer: No fixed limit. Define as many categories as needed: frameworks, databases, libraries, tools, and services.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my CI/CD pipeline?
faq.answer: This skill guides AI behavior. CI/CD integration requires separate tooling to validate configurations.

faq.question: Is my stack data stored securely?
faq.answer: Stack definitions are stored locally in your project. No data is sent to external services by this skill.

faq.question: Why is my tech stack not being applied?
faq.answer: Ensure the tech-stack.md file exists in the expected location and contains valid technology definitions.

faq.question: How does this differ from a .claude.json configuration?
faq.answer: Global tech stack provides detailed technology guidance while .claude.json handles AI behavior settings. They complement each other.
